skill.name: allaymc-plugin-dev
skill.description: Build, update, and troubleshoot AllayMC plugins in Java or other JVM languages. Use when creating a new AllayMC plugin, migrating an existing plugin to a new Allay API version, wiring commands/events/tasks/config, or setting up Gradle and plugin metadata (plugin.json or AllayGradle plugin block).

skill.author: AllayMC

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-only skill containing documentation and guidance for AllayMC plugin development. No executable code, scripts, network operations, or file system access beyond the skill's own directory. References external git submodules that are initialized by the user.

content.value_statement: AllayMC plugin development requires specific knowledge of the API structure, Gradle configuration, and Java patterns. This skill provides step-by-step guidance using official templates and bundled reference documentation. Developers can quickly create, configure, and troubleshoot plugins without searching through scattered resources.
actual_capabilities: Initialize new AllayMC plugins from official Java templates
Configure Gradle build files with AllayGradle plugin settings
Implement plugin lifecycle methods (onLoad, onEnable, onDisable)
Register commands, events, tasks, and configuration files
Build and test plugins using Gradle commands
Troubleshoot plugin loading and API version issues
limitations: Provides guidance only, does not execute code on user systems
Requires git submodule initialization for reference materials
Does not include runtime plugin testing environment

use_cases.title: Start a new plugin project
use_cases.description: Generate a complete plugin structure from the official template with proper Gradle configuration.

use_cases.title: Migrate existing plugins
use_cases.description: Update plugin code and Gradle settings to align with newer Allay API versions.

use_cases.title: Add features to plugins
use_cases.description: Implement commands, event listeners, scheduled tasks, and configuration management.

prompt_templates.title: Create new plugin
prompt_templates.prompt: Use allaymc-plugin-dev to create a new AllayMC plugin skeleton named [plugin-name] with group [com.example]. Include commands registration and a basic configuration file.

prompt_templates.title: Add event handling
prompt_templates.prompt: Use allaymc-plugin-dev to help me register event listeners for player join and quit events in my AllayMC plugin. Show me the listener structure and registration code.

prompt_templates.title: Configure build settings
prompt_templates.prompt: Use allaymc-plugin-dev to help me configure the build.gradle.kts file for my AllayMC plugin. I need to set the API version, authors field, and plugin entrance correctly.

prompt_templates.title: Debug loading issues
prompt_templates.prompt: Use allaymc-plugin-dev to help me troubleshoot why my AllayMC plugin is not loading. The plugin entrance is [package.MainClass] and I am targeting API version [version].

output_examples.input: Create a new AllayMC plugin with commands and events
output: Added commands registration following Allay API patterns
Build with ./gradlew shadowJar, deploy to plugins/

best_practices: Always align the Gradle allay.api version with your target Allay server version.
Keep plugin.entrance consistent between build.gradle.kts and plugin.json files.
Use onLoad for lightweight setup and onEnable for runtime registrations.
Test plugins locally with ./gradlew runServer before deployment.
anti_patterns: Do not hardcode API versions without verifying compatibility with your Allay server.
Do not skip the null-safety checks in method parameters and return values.
Do not use the wrong package name for the group in build.gradle.kts.

faq.question: Which Java version does this skill target?
faq.answer: The skill defaults to Java 21 toolchain as per the official template. Older versions require manual configuration.

faq.question: Can I use Kotlin instead of Java?
faq.answer: Yes, AllayMC supports JVM languages. You will need to configure Kotlin in build.gradle.kts and adjust the plugin entrance.

faq.question: How do I update the submodules?
faq.answer: Run git pull --recursively and git submodule update --init --recursive to refresh all reference materials.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads documentation files and provides guidance. It does not access your files or send data externally.

faq.question: Why is my plugin not loading?
faq.answer: Common causes include mismatched plugin.entrance, incorrect API version, or the jar not being in the server plugins directory.

faq.question: How does this compare to other Minecraft plugin skills?
faq.answer: This skill specifically targets AllayMC servers with official API references. Other skills may target different server platforms like Paper or Spigot.
